conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure.
It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
What is the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side?

The image shows velocity-time graphs for Cars A and B. Car A's graph is a straight line with a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 0 to t = 10 s, and then it remains at rest. Car B's graph is a straight line with a constant acceleration from t = 0 to t = 20 s, reaching a velocity of 40 m/s, and then it maintains this velocity.
At t = 0, both cars are at rest, so their initial positions are the same.
By t = 10 s, Car A reaches a velocity of 40 m/s and remains at this velocity until t = 20 s. Car B accelerates to 40 m/s by t = 20 s and maintains this velocity.
At t = 20 s, both cars have the same velocity of 40 m/s, so they are side by side.
From t = 20 s to t = 30 s, Car A is at rest, while Car B continues at 40 m/s.
At t = 30 s, both cars are side by side again.
To find the maximum distance between them, calculate the distance Car B travels from t = 20 s to t = 30 s, which is 40 m/s * 10 s = 400 m.
Since Car A is at rest during this time, the maximum distance between them is 400 m.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 400 m.
